description: html: when a parse test fails, don't bother testing rendering.

messages.text:
Hello andybalholm@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Sounds like a good idea, but I think you're doing twice as much work as necessary to make it work. :-)

http://codereview.appspot.com/5248061/diff/5001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go
File src/pkg/html/parse_test.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5248061/diff/5001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go#newcode169
src/pkg/html/parse_test.go:169: continue
I don't think this second continue is necessary, because it's at the end of the loop.

Andy, if the change Looks Good To You, can you reply starting with "LGTM", so that codereview.appspot.com is happy?

http://codereview.appspot.com/5248061/diff/5001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go
File src/pkg/html/parse_test.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5248061/diff/5001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go#newcode169
src/pkg/html/parse_test.go:169: continue
On 2011/10/12 15:35:59, andybalholm wrote:
> I don't think this second continue is necessary, because it's at the end of the
> loop.

It's not necessary, but it's there for consistency.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=39b032a9fa3f ***

html: when a parse test fails, don't bother testing rendering.

R=andybalholm
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5248061
